chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A Rainwater was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw Or Discharge Bodily Fluids At Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation to be lowered from 3 years to 2 years if there is an agreement between DOC and the  Washington County Drug Treatment Judge.
Complete all programming in the Washington County Drug Treatment Program.
Court will allow for transfer of probation to Washington County.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid during period of probation.  If revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the Washington County Judge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley A Rainwater

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Ashley A Rainwater.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Complete all programming in the Washington County Drug Treatment Program.
- Serve 30 DAYS in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED, and to be used at the discretion of the Washington County Judge.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Complete 40 hours of community service.
- Probation to be lowered from 3 years to 2 years, if there is an agreement between DOC and the Washington County Drug Treatment Judge.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court will allow for transfer of probation to Washington County.

Defendant Ashley A Rainwater not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Ashley A Rainwater.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are requesting an adjournment of the sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance; Received and Filed.

Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  Court further orders enchancer charge associated to Count 1 be DISMISSED OUTRIGHT. 


Sentencing proceeded.
...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.
For reasons stated on the record, Court adjourned sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Ashley A Rainwater not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Wieting.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ashley A Rainwater not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for preliminary hearing.  SPD did not appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Ashley A Rainwater in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashley A Rainwater appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
